Biology_111_r.News Finding: "In our study, we observed a widely variable bleaching and mortality response among corals," Marcelino says.
Biology_111_r.Paper Finding: Coral colonies, inhabiting the same reef and apparently exposed to identical conditions, will bleach and die at different rates Obura, 2001; .
Biology_111_r.News Context:
Rainforests of the sea

The index provides a valuable new tool to conservationists and park managers committed to preserving coral reefs and scientists interested in learning more about the hundreds of reef-building corals. "In our study, we observed a widely variable bleaching and mortality response among corals," Marcelino says. "Now, with the index, we have a platform we can use to better understand bleaching mechanisms, both intrinsic and environmental.
Biology_111_r.Paper Context: Within a bleaching event, coral susceptibility to stress is highly uneven. Coral colonies, inhabiting the same reef and apparently exposed to identical conditions, will bleach and die at different rates Obura, 2001; . Knowing which of many potential factors determine differential bleaching susceptibility among taxa will be essential to understanding bleaching mechanisms, and to preserve, manage, or reconstruct coral assemblages.
Biology_111_r.text: ['Finding: "In our study, we observed a widely variable bleaching and mortality response among corals," Marcelino says.']
Biology_111_r.displayed_text: Finding: "In our study, we observed a widely variable bleaching and mortality response among corals," Marcelino says.

Biology_tweet_33_r.News Finding: New #RegisteredReport published in #RSOS by @username at the  @username and Netta Weinstein at @username explores the relationship between adolescents playing violent video games and their likelihood of behaving aggressively. Find out more at
Biology_tweet_33_r.Paper Finding: The results provide confirmatory evidence that violent video game engagement, on balance, is not associated with observable variability in adolescents' aggressive behaviour.
Biology_tweet_33_r.News Context: New #RegisteredReport published in #RSOS by @username at the  @username and Netta Weinstein at @username explores the relationship between adolescents playing violent video games and their likelihood of behaving aggressively. Find out more at
Biology_tweet_33_r.Paper Context: This is among the first studies to test the effects of violent gaming on human aggression using a preregistered hypothesis-testing framework and the first to do so following the registered reports protocol. The results provide confirmatory evidence that violent video game engagement, on balance, is not associated with observable variability in adolescents' aggressive behaviour. A healthy ecosystem of exploratory and registered research reports will enable scientists to conduct metanalytic research to evaluate the inferences drawn from these methodologies.

Biology_56_r.News Finding: Eating instant noodles at least twice a week was associated with 68% more cardiometabolic syndrome for women, regardless of what else their diet was made up of.
Biology_56_r.Paper Finding: The consumption of instant noodles was associated with increased prevalence of metabolic syndrome in women, independent of major dietary patterns.
Biology_56_r.News Context: Neither of those diets on the whole were associated with an uptick in cardio-metabolic syndrome--which is a collection of risk factors for heart disease, type-2 diabetes and stroke including high blood pressure, blood sugar, and cholesterol. Eating instant noodles at least twice a week was associated with 68% more cardiometabolic syndrome for women, regardless of what else their diet was made up of. This effect was only seen in women.
Biology_56_r.Paper Context: The 2 major dietary patterns were associated with distinct cardiometabolic risk factors. The consumption of instant noodles was associated with increased prevalence of metabolic syndrome in women, independent of major dietary patterns. The prevalence of overweight in the adult population increased from 26% in 1998 to 32% in 2007 (1) and that of metabolic syndrome in the adult population increased from 25% to 31% in the same time period .
Biology_56_r.text: ['Finding: Eating instant noodles at least twice a week was associated with 68% more cardiometabolic syndrome for women, regardless of what else their diet was made up of.']
Biology_56_r.displayed_text: Finding: Eating instant noodles at least twice a week was associated with 68% more cardiometabolic syndrome for women, regardless of what else their diet was made up of.

Biology_tweet_1_r.News Finding: Just published in Nature: "...In any case, the burned area is robustly projected to increase. The higher the warming level is, the larger is the increase of burned area, ranging from ~40% to ~100% across the scenarios"
Biology_tweet_1_r.Paper Finding: The higher the warming level is, the larger is the increase of burned area, ranging from~40% to~100% across the scenarios.
Biology_tweet_1_r.News Context: Just published in Nature: "...In any case, the burned area is robustly projected to increase. The higher the warming level is, the larger is the increase of burned area, ranging from ~40% to ~100% across the scenarios"
Biology_tweet_1_r.Paper Context: In any case, the burned area is robustly projected to increase. The higher the warming level is, the larger is the increase of burned area, ranging from~40% to~100% across the scenarios. Our results indicate that significant benefits would be obtained if warming were limited to well below 2°C.

Biology_tweet_66_r.News Finding: Synthetic self-propelled swimming bio-bots:  (powered by cardiomyocytes)
Biology_tweet_66_r.Paper Finding: The study thus provides a foundation for a new class of self-propelled, batch-fabricable, soft biological swimming machines.
Biology_tweet_66_r.News Context: Synthetic self-propelled swimming bio-bots:  (powered by cardiomyocytes)
Biology_tweet_66_r.Paper Context: Although only cardiomyocytes are used as contractile cells in this work, the method is applicable to other homotypic cell types, such as optogenetic muscle cells for light-actuated swimming, or heterotypic cells types, such as turtle cardiomyocytes and fibroblasts for room temperature swimming, and neurons and muscle cells for sensing-based intelligent swimming. The study thus provides a foundation for a new class of self-propelled, batch-fabricable, soft biological swimming machines. The cross-section of the channel determines the shape of the PDMS filament.

Biology_tweet_66_r.displayed_text: Finding: Synthetic self-propelled swimming bio-bots: (powered by cardiomyocytes)

Biology_41_r.News Finding: X Chromosome Dosage Influences DNA Methylation Dynamics during Reprogramming to Mouse iPSCs.
Biology_41_r.Paper Finding: Therefore, differences in DNA methylation correlate with the X chromosome status of iPSCs.
Biology_41_r.News Context: Note: material may have been edited for length and content. For further information, please contact the cited source. X Chromosome Dosage Influences DNA Methylation Dynamics during Reprogramming to Mouse iPSCs.
Biology_41_r.Paper Context: Specifically, iPSCs and ESCs clustered into two main groups ( Figure 1D ). Therefore, differences in DNA methylation correlate with the X chromosome status of iPSCs. These data suggested that the first principal component, which correlated with the number of active X chromosomes and captured the separation of XO/XY and XX ESCs/iPSCs as well as most variation in methylation ( Figure 1D ), corresponded to the previously described global difference in methylation between established male and female PSCs or XO and XX female PSCs (Choi et al., , 2017a .
Biology_41_r.text: ['Finding: X Chromosome Dosage Influences DNA Methylation Dynamics during Reprogramming to Mouse iPSCs.']
Biology_41_r.displayed_text: Finding: X Chromosome Dosage Influences DNA Methylation Dynamics during Reprogramming to Mouse iPSCs.
